course_format: Duration of the course is 16 academic hours. (Usually 2 days or 4 half-days).
The course includes approximately 40% hands on lab work.
language: The course is given in Hebrew with slides and materials in English.
objectives: Understand and use the Linux/Unix terminal in effective way
Be comfortable with most of the command line tools available in Linux/Unix
Learn using Bash to make the daily work efficient
prerequisites: Basic familiarity with MS Windows or Mac OSX.
Experience with a text editor like notepad, emacs, vi, or pico.
Basic understanding of files and directories.

entries: Unix and Linux, a brief history
Philosophy - Open Source, Free Software, Freware, Propriatery Software
Open Source Licenses -  GNU GPL, BSD and in between
Linux distributions (Fedora, RedHat, CentOS, Debiam, Ubuntu etc.)
syllabus.title: Introduction

entries: Overview of a few selected desktop applications
e-mail, web browsing, word processor, spreadsheet, file system browser
syllabus.title: Linux as Desktop

entries: Accessing Linux from another computer (telnet, ssh, putty)
syllabus.title: Setting up your Linux Shell

entries: Executing Commands in a Bash Script
syllabus.title: Writing Scripts with Bash

entries: Utilities such as cut, paste, sort, uniq, head, tail, wc
Comparing files with cmp, diff, patch
syllabus.title: Working with Files

entries: Monitoring Processes with top, htop, ps, pgrep
syllabus.title: Processes

target_audience: The course is intended for technical personnel who need to use the Linux/Unix terminal on a daily basis, in an effective manner.
title: Linux Basics for Power Users
